intro: Gynoxys tetroici, commonly known as the four-lobed gynoxys, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features palmate leaves with four to five lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically producing a yellowish or greenish hue. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
